title: Show full decimal precision for division results

requirements.text: When a division operation produces a non-terminating or long decimal result (e.g., 10 ÷ 3), display the full precision result up to 10 decimal places (e.g., 3.3333333333) instead of truncating to 2 decimal places.
acceptanceCriteria: 10 ÷ 3 displays as 3.3333333333 (10 decimal places) in the calculator result area.
Division results that are whole numbers (e.g., 10 ÷ 2 = 5) are displayed without unnecessary trailing zeros.
Division results with fewer than 10 significant decimal digits (e.g., 1 ÷ 4 = 0.25) are displayed exactly without padding zeros.
The fix applies to both the live preview display and the confirmed result display in CalculatorDisplay.tsx.
History entries saved to the backend also reflect the full precision value.
Other operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, power, square root) are unaffected.

constraints: Do not alter immutable frontend paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not change the backend data model or Motoko actor signature.
nonGoals: Changing the display precision for non-division operations.
